Mean magnetic declination (MD) 20Âº 31â west of true north (1998.10)
Mean annual change (AC) 4â westwards (1995â2001)

Calculate the magnetic bearing from trig. beacon 8 to spot height 120 for 2012.
MB = TB + MD
TB = 57Â° (56Â°â 58Â°)
MD = 20Â°31â W of TN
AC = 4â W
2012 â 1998 = 14 years 
14 Ã 4â W = 56â W
MD = 20Â° 31â W + 56â W
 
= 20Â° 87â W of TN
 
= 21Â° 27â W of TN
MB = 21Â° 27â + 57Â°
  
= 77Â° 27â â 79Â° 27â
Position/co-ordinates
Co-ordinates are a set of two numbers that indicate the exact position  
of any point on Earth. Latitude is the co-ordinate that specifies the northâ
south position of a point on the Earthâs surface. Longitude is the co-
ordinate that specifies the eastâwest position of a point on the Earthâs 
surface.
Co-ordinates are useful as they tell us exactly where a place or landform is.
